19.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

19.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
19.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A fisherman. From hals; a sailor, i.e. a fisher.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

20.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fishing-net. Probably from a primary verb diko; a seine.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
21.str2: To go forward, advance. From pro and the base of basis; to walk forward, i.e. Advance.
Thence, from that place. From ekei; thence.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Zebedee, father of the apostles James and John. Of Hebrew origin; Zebedaeus, an Israelite.
And, even, also, namely.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Zebedee, father of the apostles James and John. Of Hebrew origin; Zebedaeus, an Israelite.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
21.str2: From kata and a derivative of artios; to complete thoroughly, i.e. Repair or adjust.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A fishing-net. Probably from a primary verb diko; a seine.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
22.str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To lead or carry about (or around), go about, traverse. From peri and ago; to take around; reflexively, to walk around.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
23.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
And, even, also, namely.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.
And, even, also, namely.
Weakness, illness, sickness. From malakos; softness, i.e. Enervation.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

24.str2: Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia. Probably of Hebrew origin; Syria, a region of Asia.
And, even, also, namely.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Badly, evilly, wrongly. From kakos; badly.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
24.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
24.str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.
Torture, torment, examination by torture. Perhaps remotely from the same as basis; a touch-stone, i.e. torture.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
24.str2: To be possessed, be under the power of an evil-spirit or demon. Middle voice from daimon; to be exercised by a d?Mon.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
24.str2: To be a lunatic, be moonstruck, epileptic.
And, even, also, namely.
Afflicted with paralysis. From a derivative of paraluo; as if dissolved, i.e. 'paralytic'.
And, even, also, namely.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

25.str2: From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
25.str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
From deka and polis; the ten-city region; the Decapolis, a district in Syria.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
Over, on the other side, beyond. Apparently accusative case of an obsolete derivative of peiro; through, i.e. Across.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; the Jordanes, a river of Palestine.
